alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Eastern Chester; Western Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 2:47AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of New Castle, Salem, northwestern Gloucester, central Chester and southern Delaware Counties through 315 AM EDT... At 247 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Glasgow, or near Elkton, moving north at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Newark, Middletown, West Chester, Chester, Glassboro, Pennsville, Coatesville, Westtown, Pitman, Carneys Point, Downingtown, Swarthmore, Elsmere, Paulsboro, Kennett Square, New Castle, Penns Grove, Salem and Woodstown. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 1 and 2. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 301 and 313. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 9. Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 1 and 23. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 19. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
